title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.3: ECCD AND PRE-PRIMARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 1.3: By 2023, improved capacity of the Government (Ministry of Education and Training, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Social Development) to provide high quality early childhood development, care and pre-primary education., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1:By 2023, young children (0 to 9 years), particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from gender responsive health, nutrition and early learning services.

sector.narrative: System strengthening - Evidence based education sector planning
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary teaching and learning environment (including curriculum and material design)
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.3: By 2023, improved capacity of the Government (Ministry of Education and Training, Ministry of Health, Ministry ofSocial Development) to provide high quality early childhood development, care and pre-primary education.

description.narrative: UNICEF support to Ministry of Education and Training (MOET) resulted in the first ever revision of the Early Childhood Care and Development curriculum in more than two decades. This new play-based curriculum will benefit 47,447 (23,538 males, 23,909 females) children in pre-schools. In response to COVID-19, online learning was introduced which benefitted 238 students (100 in Diploma and 138 enrolled in certificate courses on ECCD). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2021
